title: Jingyi Guan
text:
Résumé
  
  
    
     
  
  
    
     
  

      

About Jingyi (she/her)
I am an undergraduate student at Macalester College studying Statistics, Psychology, and Computer Science. I am currently working on my Honors Thesis, “Topological Data Analysis of Knowledge Networks,” to study how science evolves under the supervision of Prof. Lori Ziegelmeier.


    
    
  



Research Interest
I aspire to develop novel statistical methods with machine learning and create new statistical, computational, and bioinformatics techniques to study complex diseases and neuropsychiatric disorders using high-dimensional data. Through the integration of high-throughput data and clinical information, I aim to uncover the genetic factors and biomarkers influencing patient survival and unravel the complex pathologies of these under-studied conditions. My research goal is to provide valuable insights into disease mechanisms and therapeutic strategies, offering hope to patients facing limited treatment options.


Education
Macalester College | St. Paul, MN  B.A. in Statistics, Minors in Psychology and Computer Science | GPA: 4.0 | Sept 2020 - May 2024


Programming Skills
Languages: R, Java, Python, SQL, MATLAB
Utilities: Rstudio, Anaconda, Git, Jupiter Notebook, Tableau


Selected Coursework
Mathematics/Statistics: Mathematical Statistics, Statistical Genetics, Survival Analysis, Probability, Real Analysis (in progress), Topology, Computational Linear Algebra, Statistical Machine Learning, Introduction to Statistical Modeling
Computer Science: Computational Geometry (in progress), Algorithm Design & Analysis, Data Structures, Object-Oriented Programming and Abstraction
Neuroscience/Psychology: Behavioral Neuroscience, Introduction to Neuroscience, Neuroscience of Reward (planned), Educational Psychology, Introduction to Psychology

Chan Lab, Department of Pediatrics, University of Minnesota

Neuromodulation Research Center, Department of Neuroloogy, University of Minnesota
